Comment: > Curious what you think it says about the Democratic Party that the republican ass-clown beat their supposed “alpha”?  Probably says we live in a country where [54% of the adult population can't read above a sixth grade level](https://www.apmresearchlab.org/10x-adult-literacy) and can't figure out you shouldn't vote for a 34-count felon who claims Haitians are eating cats and dogs in Ohio on a televised debate because of a Facebook meme someone told him about.  Like if 80 million people can't watch this pants-shitting octogenarian clown fuck and simply listen to the things he says and does and come to the conclusion that he isn't qualified to manage Wendy's, let alone their entire nation, that says far more about the voting electorate than it does any of the candidates on offer.   Democrats also don't claim that their candidate is or needs to be some fucking pathetic totem of masculine perfection, because we're not deeply, emotionally crippled weirdos who stopped emotionally and intellectually maturing in middle school and who think that unscientific and patently false hierarchies in wolves somehow translates to modern, literate human society.   Do you choose your accountant by which one is best at punching people in the face? You think the best air traffic controllers to keep you safe while flying are the ones who keep a gun at their hip at all times because they're too scared to exist in public without a deadly weapon? Bunch of losers cosplaying Wild Bill Hickok while shopping for 24 packs of diet coke at Walmart?  Violent people aren't the best of us. Their capacity for violence only indicates a proficiency at violence. Not at any other human endeavor but most especially any endeavor requirint intellectual thought, creativity, and keeping a cool head in crises. You don't put the person best at murder at the head of the army. You put the cleverest. The ones able to manage the logistics of an army on the march, able to strategize at scale and do the mental work requisite to achieve goals.  Violent ones are the ones that don't have the mental capacity to exist in any other way except the most savage and least-intellectually demanding of existences and in nearly every possible case they are the worst choice for a leader.  I don't want a POTUS who photoshops himself on a muscular body he can never attain in real life holding a light saber from a movie he never watched. That's a mentally deranged individual. If you do that while occupying an office whose decisions affect the lives and livelihoods of billions of people on this planet then you fundamentally don't posess the maturity to serve in a job that significant.  Donald Trump is emotionally a toddler. I don't mean that as an insult. I mean that he is deeply mentally damaged and displays the emotional and intellectual capacities of a young child. That's a really, really bad thing. He needs a constantly, endless supply of validation to feel even the remote sense of fleeting happiness, because his dad endlessly physically and verbally abused him as a child and raised him to be a pathological narcissist endlessly seeking attention and validation and never knowing a moment of love or contentment in his miserable crime-filled life.  And I had the naive hope that I lived in a country where that would have been obvious to enough of the voting public, too.   Because it is obvious. If you can't see that it's obvious, then you need to ask yourself how loose your grip on reality really is.  POTUS is a bureaucrat elected to fulfill a routine administrative function. Which, yes, unfortunately requires a reading comprehension beyond the sixth grade level to grasp it should be a level-headed, experienced legislature who is familiar with the federal bureuacracy, and not a reality TV show host with profound mental health issues and a lifetime of evidence of poor decision-making, bankrupted businesses, emotional impetuousness, and innumerable other failings each of which individually would disqualify him from holding office in a serious country with a far better literacy rate.
Author: StoppableHulk

Comment: He was elected president, and it's been downhill ever since. We have a right to expect better.

This isn't about the Democrats. It's about Trump being a joke.  What Trump's election says, though, is that we're collectively a bunch of morons that value authenticity (including authentically crazy) over competence. Pausing to consider a response is seen as a weakness, whereas spouting whatever nonsense enters your brain in the moment is seen as strength. It doesn't matter that the former makes for a MUCH better president than the latter, the American people know what they want.   I listened to an interview recently where a question included the fact that politician had been involved in politics as a child and she responded "you just broke the first rule of politics - pretend that you just woke up one day and decided to run." That joke says so much about how stupid voters are, and how aware of it politicians are.
